NATIONAL EDUCATION ASSOCIATION
1201 SIXTEENTH STREET NORTHWEST, WASHINGTON 6, D. C.
Officers and National Delegates
WALTER A. WITTICH, President
Director, Bureau of Audio-Visual
Instruction, University of Wisconsin
L. C. LARSON, Vice-President
Director, Audio-Visual Center,
Indiana University
LEE W. COCHRAN, Past President
Executive Assistant, Extension
Division, State University of Iowa
WALTER S. BELL
Director, Audio-Visual Education,
Atlanta (Ga.) Public Schools
April 10, 1956
Audio-Visual Communication Review
WILLIAM H. ALLEN, Editor
Department of Cinema
University of Southern California
Los Angeles 7, California
Mr. Harry J. Skornia
Executive Director
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
14 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
IRENE F. CYPHER
Associate Professor of Education,
New York University
AMO DE BERNARDIS
Assistant Superintendent,
Portland (Ore.) Public Schools
Dear Harry:
Please accept my thanks for sending me a carbon of your
April 3 letter to Harold E. Wigren.
ROBERT deKIEFFER
Director, Bureau of Audio-Visual
Instruction, University of Colorado
MARGARET W. DIVIZIA
Supervisor, Audio-Visual Section,
Los Angeles City Schools
I'm sorry that I missed the ETV panel at the Convention.
And this does remind me - if you know of anyone whom you
could recommend for a good ETV article, I’d like to have
it because we’d like to carry one or two in our May issue
of Instructional Materials.
ELIZABETH GOLTERMAN
Director, Division of Audio-Visual
Education, St. Louis Public Schools
HENRY R. McCARTY
Director, West Texas Cooperative
Audio-Visual Servic^
Texas Technological College
At any time, if you run across anybody doing outstanding
work, we would be very much interested in them. We are
constantly on the lookout for good articles on closed cir¬
cuit and open circuit television that can be useful to
school administrators.
j. j. McPherson
Director, Audio-Visual Consultation
Bureau, Wayne University
PAUL W. F. WITT
Professor of Education, Teachers
College, Columbia University
It was very good to see you the other day, and I’m sorry
I didn’t have more of a chance to talk with you in Detroit.
Cordially,
National Staff
FLOYDE E. BROOKER
Acting Executive Secretary
ANNA L. HYER
Associate Executive Secretary
Floyde E. Brooker
Executive Secretary
FLORENCE IH-CHI FAN FEBJ mnW
Administrative Assistant .
MARY C. WELCH
